alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot; Central Washington; Interior Hancock; Northern Washington; Southern Penobscot; Southern Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 25 at 2:44PM EST until January 26 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 10 inches, sleet accumulations up to one tenth of an inch and ice accumulations up to one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of Central Highlands, Far Eastern, Interior DownEast, and Penobscot Valley Maine * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 10 AM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Visibilities may drop below one quarter mile due to falling and blowing snow Thursday morning. The strong winds and weight of snow on tree limbs combined with ice may down power lines and could cause sporadic power outages. Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions will impact the Thursday morning commute.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of snow, sleet, and ice will make travel extremely dangerous. The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to newengland511.org.
